topics.title: Ankle Sprain
first_aid: Apply ice (15-20 minutes every hour for first 24 hours)
Elevate the ankle above heart level
recovery: Rest for several days depending on severity
Strengthen with balance and mobility exercises
topics.disclaimer: This is first aid only. Prolonged pain, instability, or swelling should be evaluated by a licensed medical professional.

topics.title: Nosebleed
symptoms: Bleeding from one or both nostrils
first_aid: Keep the child calm and seated upright
Lean forward slightly — do not tilt head back
Pinch the nostrils together for 10-15 minutes
Apply a cold compress to the nose bridge
recovery: Avoid blowing nose for a few hours
Use humidifier or saline spray if recurring
topics.disclaimer: This is first aid only. Seek medical attention if bleeding is heavy or doesn’t stop after 20 minutes.

topics.title: Muscle Cramp
first_aid: Apply heat if not immediately after activity
Ensure hydration with water or electrolytes
topics.disclaimer: This is first aid only. Persistent cramps may signal dehydration or mineral imbalance and should be evaluated by a healthcare professional.
